text: arrow to Chennai is the common term for
an Indian influenced Malaysian style
flatbread it starts with a little ball
of gooey dough that is stretched and
slapped into a paper than sheet and
either paired with an egg or just fold
it over and fry it on the griddle plain
some oil and a few dabs of butter keep
the roti sizzling and ensure it
transforms into a beautiful golden-brown
nasaan the outside the Cook flips it
over a number of times as the dope
bubbles up and slowly cooks the multiple
thin layers of dough create a flaky
flatbread that's crispy on the outside
and still doughy on the inside it'll
teach and I would not be complete
without a dipping bowl of curry sauce on

stall for a simple yet rewarding
Malaysian breakfast okay so I just sat
down at this little roadside stall in

popular for breakfast is called roti
roti Chennai and rotate roll this one is

crispy on the outside
fluffy and doughy on the inside and
expertise on its salty it's a little bit

we drive Lisa mcclain druggie
once again dip it in the curry sauce
